Local iwi | blank_info = Ngāi Tahu | footnotes = }} Ashburton () is a town in the Canterbury Region, on the east coast of the South Island of New Zealand The town has a population of . == History == The town was established in 1858, . The Canterbury government gave Ashburton £20,000 to build roads in the district in 1873 and a railway in 1874. The Presbyterian church was established in 1876 and the Catholic church in 1882. Ashburton was listed as a borough in 1878. Ashburton was used as a training base for the Royal New Zealand Air Force during World War 2. == References == == Sources == * == Other websites == * Ashburton District Council * AshburtonOnline Category:Towns in Canterbury Region Category:Ashburton District Category:1850s establishments in Oceania Category:19th-century establishments in New Zealand
